Is the suspect not allowed to be worried to find an officer to shoot first before the suspect?
I'm not defending the convict, he had a history in prison and had just came out.
I only saw that guy run away, does that warrant being shot in the back?
I don't know what happened before so perhaps they did the right thing. Just my thoughts on the subject is all! I'm from the UK so as you know gun laws here are very strict!

In the U.K. that man wouldn't have been shot so easily. You could hear the worry on the officers voice. It sounded like a worry shot than anything.
I'm not saying he shouldn't have shot as I would have done the same but it's sad to see a life get taken that quickly and effortlessly.
I thing that upsets me is this could have all been resolved with a quick taser shot. No guns needed!

From the UK, currently going from my road bike to a BMX.
Road bike was for travel means but now I have a motorbike. I miss the feeling of the pushing pedals and just getting out there. I want to have fun on a bicycle again.
I'm 6ft 6 and have been struggling to find frames that would go up to my size. Anyone been in my situation and found a solution?
I'm wanting to build my own bike up, to make it my precious. Any websites or tips would be recommended!
Looking forward to hitting the road again..
Edit : Wanting to use the bike for tricks on land not so much jumps, so would like somewhat of a sturdy bike.

WRITING.TITLE: Taking over an old business Facebook account.
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey there everyone, wonder if anyone can help me.
I am working for a company that recently acquired another company in the area. They have a big online presence on Facebook but the previous owners are unable to find the log in details.
Is there any way that the account can be verified by a business address or verified in any way so that we can edit and put out new posts.
We don't want to start a new account for the company as we'd lose a lot of followers and have to gain them again.
I've tried to contact Facebook but can't seem to find anything.
Any help would be appreciated!
Huck

WRITING.TITLE: Reading the UK NHS guidelines on milk
WRITING.TEXT:
Milk is especially important for young children. They should drink whole milk until they are two years old because they may not get the calories they need from lower-fat milks.
Cows' milk should not be given as a drink until a baby is one year old as it doesn't contain the balance of nutrients a baby needs.
From the age of two, children can gradually move to semi-skimmed milk as a main drink as long as they are eating a varied and balanced diet and growing well.
Just reading this makes me think how far we actually have to come..
